attribute_description: The disease state(s) of the individual donating the sample at the time of donation
The single cell RNA-sequencing protocol used for Library preparation
The organ that the biomaterial came from
The scientific binomial name for the species of the organism.
Cell type name determined via unsupervised clustering and marker genes

dependency_condition: sample_type in cell line, organoid, cultured primary cells
attribute_description: length of time cells have been in culture
A classification of the developmental stage of the organism
If evidence of a pathogen is detected in this cell
Amount of time since disease onset
Amount of time since treatment was started (for drugs/continuous treatment) or performed (for surgery/immediate intervention)
If the donor was treated at the time the sample was collected
A description of the treatment given to this donor

controlled_list_entries: ["3 prime tag", "3 prime end bias", "5 prime tag", "5 prime end bias", "full length"]
attribute_description: The end bias of the library preparation protocol used
The cell type that was sorted via an enrichment technique such as flow cytometry.
The surface markers that were sorted on to enrich for the enriched cell type if flow cytometry was used

controlled_list_entries: ["cell size selection", "fluorescence-activated cell sorting", "magnetic affinity cell sorting", "laser capture microdissection", "density gradient centrifugation", "Ficoll-Hypaque method", "enrichment of methylated DNA"]
attribute_description: Method used to enrich cells before running library preparation. This could be flow cytometry, column enrichments, etc.
The ethnicity or ethnicities of the human donor if known
A perturbation to a gene done to a cell culture

The type of perturbation of the gene defined in gene_perturbation. Knock in and knock out are complete additions/depletions of the gene, activation and repression refer to changes in magnitude of expression.
Description of the timing with respect to sequencing and other logistical considerations of the gene perturbation
Process by which the gene was perturbed. Ex. CRISPR knock-out
Location where the sample was collected/donated

dependency_condition: sample_type in cell line, organoid, cultured primary cells
attribute_description: a growth factor added to a cell culture media
Concentration of of each growth factor in the final tissue culture media. Order should be consistent with growth_factor_perturbation
Solvent in which the growth factor was added to the cells. Ex. the base media.
Source from which the growth factor was purchased
Whether organism was alive at time of biomaterial collection
MHC genotype for humans and other species
Mouse strain of the donor organism (ex. C57BL/6, BALB/c, 129, undetermined)
Number of reads mapped to that cell
Age of the organism at time of sample collection.
true if the sequence library has paired end data (false for 10x)
Primer used for cDNA synthesis from RNA
An arbitrary classification of a taxonomic group that is a division of a species
the read structure of the sequencing run
a small molecule added to a cell culture (ex. A drug) growth factor (and if it is recombinant, concentration), gene)
Concentration of each small molecule in the final tissue culture media. Order should be consistent with small_molecule_perturbation
Solvent in which the small molecule was added to the cells. Ex. the base media.
Source from which the small molecule was purchased
Any known vaccines administered to the donor organism. NOT a full vaccine history
Any adjuvants administered in the vaccine
The dosage and units for the vaccine
Amount of time since vaccine was administered
Time since each vaccine in the vaccination field was administered
